movies.title: The Castle of Sand
movies.plot: Detectives investigate the murder of an old man found in a Tokyo rail yard.
movies.simplePlot: Detectives investigate the murder of an old man found in a Tokyo rail yard.

biography.bio: Tetsurô Tamba was born on July 17, 1922 in Tokyo, Japan as Shozaburo Tanba. He was an actor and writer, known for You Only Live Twice (1967), Harakiri (1962) and Le royaume des chats (2002). He was married to Hoki. He died on September 24, 2006 in Tokyo.
biography.name: Tetsurô Tamba

biography.bio: Gô Katô was born on February 4, 1938 in Osaezaki-cho, Shizuoka, Japan. He is an actor, known for Samurai Rebellion (1967), Lone Wolf and Cub: Baby Cart to Hades (1972) and The Great Passage (2013).
biography.name: Gô Katô

biography.bio: Kensaku Morita was born on December 16, 1949 in Tokyo, Japan as Eiji Suzuki. He is an actor and writer, known for Day of Resurrection (1980), The Castle of Sand (1974) and The War in Space (1977).
biography.name: Kensaku Morita

biography.bio: Yôko Shimada was born on May 17, 1953 in Kumamoto, Japan. She is an actress and editor, known for Shogun (1980), The Inugami Family (1976) and The Hunted (1995).
biography.name: Yôko Shimada

biography.bio: Karin Yamaguchi was born on May 10, 1947 in Chuo-ku, Tokyo, Japan as Shizue Yamaguchi. She is an actress, known for The Castle of Sand (1974), Kaichô-on (1980) and Shinobugawa (1972).
biography.name: Karin Yamaguchi

biography.bio: Yoshi Katô was born on January 12, 1913 in Tokyo, Japan. He was an actor, known for Tampopo (1985), Hometown (1983) and Lone Wolf and Cub: Sword of Vengeance (1972). He was married to Isuzu Yamada. He died on March 1, 1988.
biography.name: Yoshi Katô

biography.bio: Kazuhide Haruta is an actor, known for The Castle of Sand (1974), Shaolin karaté (1975) and Hadashi no Gen: Namida no bakuhatsu (1977).
biography.name: Kazuhide Haruta

biography.bio: What an amazing career! Few can boast a longer one (64 years of activity). Few have been able to have to relate to three generations. And it is pretty sure that no one can compare with him in terms of faithfulness to a director: Chishu Ryu indeed appeared in no fewer than fifty-two out of fifty-four of his master Yasujirô Ozu. He played in 187 films or TV films and could be a very versatile actor: for instance in 1936, when he was thirty, he embodied a student in one film and an old man in another. However he was perfect in Ozu's films, most often, as a simple, unobtrusive man whose humanity is revealed through the hardships of everyday life. How could Japanese cinema have done without Chishu Ryu?
biography.name: Chishû Ryû

biography.bio: Junko Natsu was born on March 21, 1949 in Tokyo, Japan. She is an actress, known for Truck Rascals (1975), The Castle of Sand (1974) and Furyô shôjô Mako (1971).
biography.name: Junko Natsu

biography.bio: Seiji Matsuyama was born on May 21, 1947 in Tokyo, Japan. He is an actor, known for The Castle of Sand (1974), Live Your Own Way (1967) and Toshigoro (1968).
biography.name: Seiji Matsuyama

biography.bio: Taketoshi Naitô was born on June 16, 1926 in Kitakyushu, Fukuoka, Japan. He was an actor, known for The Burmese Harp (1956), After Life (1998) and The Human Condition III: A Soldier's Prayer (1961). He died on August 21, 2012 in Yokohama, Kanagawa, Japan.
biography.name: Taketoshi Naitô

biography.bio: Masumi Harukawa was born on November 10, 1935 in Tochigi, Japan. She is an actress, known for Désir meurtrier (1964), Hachi-ko (1987) and Pastoral Hide and Seek (1974).
biography.name: Masumi Harukawa

actors.character: Naka Sumie, woman at fan shop

biography.bio: Japanese character actor who achieved his greatest acclaim in the role of "Gorobei" in Akira Kurosawa's Seven Samurai (1954). Inaba began in the theatre after the Second World War, joining the Haiyu-Za company and appearing in plays such as The Cherry Orchard and The Threepenny Opera. His film debut came in 1954, and he worked steadily in the following years as a character actor, usually of a good-hearted type. He died from a heart attack in 1998.
biography.name: Yoshio Inaba

biography.bio: Tokue Hanazawa was born on October 18, 1911 in Tokyo, Japan. He was an actor, known for Kwaidan (1964), Kigeki: Onna wa dokyô (1969) and Where Spring Comes Late (1970). He died on March 7, 2001 in Shibuya, Tokyo.
biography.name: Tokue Hanazawa

biography.bio: Taiji Tonoyama was born on October 17, 1915 in Ginza, Tokyo, Japan. He was an actor, known for Onibaba, les tueuses (1964), The Naked Island (1960) and In the Realm of the Senses (1976). He died on April 30, 1989.
biography.name: Taiji Tonoyama
